reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Cheap Lot of Mice
reviews.reviewText: Looking for a large box of mice for your office? These are working out great for our office so far. I had a few mice that needed replaced and I did not want to spend the price to buy each one individually so I bought this 10 pack. Great price for the product. It feels good and works well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Bought 2 of them; one didn't work
reviews.reviewText: I bought two, and one of them doesn't move the cursor. Tried on three different computers. I know it's not a computer configuration issue because the other identical mouse from the same seller works fine.Thing is, I can't be hassled to contact the manufacturer and deal with mailing it back (during a pandemic) for a refund, all for a $7 mouse. They tell you please not to leave negative reviews, and it seems clear that they would have replaced it if I'd contacted them. So I'm giving them 4/5 stars. This is not a negative review.However, I wish they'd sent me a mouse that works. You know? It doesn't take much to plug it in and test it once before shipping it. The cardboard box had no seals of any kind -- you just reach in, take the mouse out, and plug it in. They could have done that before wasting my time and money.That being said, the other one, which works fine, is a pretty good mouse so far. Comfortable, smooth, stylish. Not bad for $14. ;-)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Nice Looking Mouse, Erratic Clicking Contacts
reviews.reviewText: I have been looking for an economical Mouse, $5 - $6 to resell and for the amount of time I spend at the computer, one that I can use as well. So far I have tried the Rii Mouse, Verbatim and this one the HONGDE.The HONGDE:This thing is HONGDE (Huge and Heavy)! It is very Slow - when moving and dragging the cursor creeps around the screen. Don't know if this has anything to do with its DPI setting. I did a few searches on Google and found nothing on how to adjust this. The buttons seem to be accurate and making good solid contact when clicking but because of its slowness in movement, using the mouse seems unresponsive. Overall, using this mouse is uncomfortable, tiring and very time wasting.The Rii Mouse:This is a real nice looking mouse; good size and good weight. It has good speed when moving and dragging. The buttons has a balanced tactile clicking action. This mouse was on its way to becoming my perfect under $6 mouse until I started using it seriously. The clicking contacts are erratic, like they are shorting. When I press and hold a button to highlight or drag it does not maintain contact even though I still have the button depressed. Then it will get worse as it will regain contact. So the mouse buttons will make contact, lose contact and regain contact erratically when depressed. Well we know that practically all Windows Based Software have specialized functions tied to the clicking action of the Mouse - positioning, highlighting, copying, cutting, pasting are the basics. Imagine these functions happening unpredictably when you are trying to work. Screwed up Documents and Worksheets mayhem. This clicking and contacting inconsistency makes the Rii Mouse very frustrating and even impossible to use.Verbatim:The Verbatim while not as pretty, looks and feels similar to the Rii Mouse, same size and weight and a little faster movement. Of all three Mice it has the most natural responsive feel. However, after about 2 to 3 months max of daily use the button contacts get worn and it begins to exhibit the same erratic and unpredictable behavior like the Rii Mouse, described above. I am changing my 3rd Verbatim Mouse today for this same reason, erratic, inconsistent, unpredictable behavior, the same as I had to change the 1st and 2nd ones.Remember I was buying these Mice for resale. I tried at least 3 or more of each of the three brands and the issues I explained for each were consistently the same for all that I tried.I will be rating them as follows - HONGDE - 2 Stars Rii Mouse - 1 Star Verbatim - 3 Stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great, and has multicoloured lights. My daughter loves it! Cheap and seems sturdy so I do too!
Leichte Bedienung. Für 4€... Unschlagbares Preis Leistungsverhältnis

Son dos ratones iguales, con cable USB y de tamaño mediano, aptos para manejar en cualquier superficie lisa sin exceso de brillo.Botones de manejo: derecho e izquierdo más rueda central. Sencillos y cómodos.Tiene luz led azul alrededor y en el logo de la marca, pensaba que a lo mejor era demasiado vistoso pero no, es una luz que es bastante sutil, dándole un toque de diferencia con los convencionales.

Il mouse si presenta con una costruzione solida e con materiali ben fatti. L'aspetto è piacevole e al tatto è confortevole. La funzionalità è quello che ci si aspetta da un mouse ottico, preciso e scorrevole. Buona la lunghezza del filo e le luci non sono invadenti. Nel complesso sono molto soddisfatto
